project_context: Social savings circles known by dozens of names across Africa lack digitized records and credit checks for their members.
In order to scale up the space in Africa, it is important to protect the work and investment
Local Saving and Credit Associations are failing due to high inflation
Current donation services lack efficiency, transparency and security. ADA microlending may be difficult due to legal barriers and trust.
The informal sector in Ghana stagnates / expands slowly because there are no low cost, efficient, reliable borrowing options
Financing for higher education is scarce in lower-income countries where a range of economic factors have eroded creditor confidence
Tontine is a popular way usually for women to raise money for micro-business but they hardly scale up to more than a few tens of people.
Cash flow to conductÂ  business is a big issue for less wealthy people in africa. Loans are difficult to get and with high interest rates
Zimbabweans have insufficient small change USD cash to match the purchases of goods or services, CheCha was developed to solve that
Most access to credit in Africa is done via traditional credit unions, which is limited by factors like; Trust, Familiarity & Capital risk.
